ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Omnigrip CST must not be applied to wet pavements under any circumstances and suspension of application should be considered:
– During periods of dew, drizzle or rain
– If the surface temperature drops below 10°C and is in decline.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Omnigrip Technical Data Sheet
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP signed off
RESPONSIBILITY: Fulton Hogan Engineer / YT Superintendent
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure that the substrate is dry and clean of all contaminates. Asphalt pavements shall be virgourously brushed or treated with compressed air to remove dust and loose aggregate.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Omnigrip Technical Data Sheet
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: The Epoxy Part A should be added to Epoxy Part B at a ratio of 1:1 and mixed using a slow speed for 90 to 120 seconds to obtain a homegenous mix. Add pigment colouring throughout the mixing process.
○ Once mixed the resin should be immediately applied & spread evenly using a serrated squeegee or notched trowel at an average rate of 1.35 - 1.7 kg/m2.
○ The resion should self-level, however, the use of a 20mm find nap roller should be used to back roll and level the resin.
○ The applied resin should receive the aggregate dressing within 10-15 minutes of application ensuring no wet resin is left exposed.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Omnigrip Technical Data Sheet
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: For any surface works on asphalt there must be a minimum curing period of 7-10 days.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: Omnigrip Technical Data Sheet
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: This ITP Signed off
